alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Oxford; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 12:37PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central and western Maine, including the following counties, in west central Maine, Somerset. In western Maine, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackman, Coburn Gore, Upper Enchanted, Parlin Pond, Attean, Hobbstown, Johnson Mountain, Long Pond, Moose River, and Dennistown Plantation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Minor flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
